alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 4:14AM PST until February 28 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING BELOW 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory below 1500 feet, periods of snow. Snow accumulations of up to 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, the higher terrain of the South Central Oregon Coast. For the Winter Weather Advisory, Highway 101 from Port Orford north to Reedsport, including Coos Bay and North Bend, but also Highway 42 from Bandon east to Coquille and Myrtle Point. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult with hazardous walking conditions due to snow covered roads and sidewalks. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers could continue into this afternoon, but most snow should melt on roadways. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
